business.headline: Sensex opens over 200 points up, Nifty above 25,100; Infosys gains 1%Sensex opens over 200 points up, Nifty above 25,100; Infosys gains 1%
Will US-Japan trade deal weigh in on Sensex, Nifty today?Gift Nifty futures were trading at 25,181.50 as of 8:30 am, indicating that the Nifty 50 may open above Tuesday's close of 25,060.90.

IPO season heating up with Rs 2.58 lakh crore in queue: Is Dalal Street ready?After a steady first half, the second half of 2025 is expected to be packed with major public issues.  In July alone, 11 mainboard IPOs have either been listed or are set to launch.

CEO quits, HR head stays: Why Astronomer didn't fire Kristin Cabot over kiss cam rowAstronomer CEO Andy Byron resigned after a viral kiss cam video showed him and HR head Kristin Cabot cuddling at a Coldplay concert, sparking public backlash. While Cabot remains employed, legal experts say contractual obligations and internal investigations likely explain the delay in any action against her.

Paytm posts Rs 123 crore profit in Q1FY26, strengthens lead in merchant paymentsOperating revenue rises 28% YoY; contribution profit up 52% as AI-led efficiencies and financial services boost bottom line.

Who Is Anish Shah, the auto CEO whose salary nearly doubled to Rs 47 crore?Anish Shah, Group CEO and managing director of the Mahindra Group, entered the list of top 5 paid auto CEOs for the first time. He received a 95% hike in pay, with his total earnings touching Rs 47.33 crore in FY25.

How a small AIS check can save you from a tax noticeIf you skip checking your AIS, you might end up missing some income details. This can lead to a mismatch between what you file and what the tax department already knows, and that can easily get you a notice later.
Sensex closes flat, Nifty below 25,100; Eternal up 11%The S&P BSE Sensex lost 13.53 points to end at 82,186.81, while the NSE Nifty50 ended lower by 29.80 points to close at 25,060.90.

Why Tesla's ride into India's EV market won't be a smooth oneTesla's entry comes at a time when it is facing its biggest drop in global sales to date. Its domestic sales in the US fell 6.3% in the second quarter of 2025, the third straight quarterly decline.
NOIDA is now tax-free. Check who benefits and howAt a time when cities are competing hard to attract businesses and investors, this tax relief could give NOIDA a fresh edge.

Government receives plea to cut 28% GST on aerated drinksThe matter is likely to be taken up at the upcoming 56th GST Council meeting, expected to be held in mid-August. The meeting is already set to review a broader rate rationalisation framework, with officials indicating that certain slabs and cesses may be simplified or merged.

Chanda Kochhar found guilty in Rs 64-crore Videocon bribe case: ReportAn appellate tribunal gave this ruling in an order dated July 3. The tribunal said that the money was routed through Kochhar's husband Deepak Kochhar, using a company connected to Videocon.

entertainment.headline: Benny Blanco's cheeky post kicks off Selena Gomez's 33rd birthday celebrationsSelena Gomez celebrated her 33rd birthday on Tuesday, July 22. Her fiancé, Benny Blanco, shared heartfelt moments on Instagram to mark the day.

Ananya Panday visits Hanuman Ji temple in Jaipur amid 'Tu Meri...' shoot. PicsBollywood actor Ananya Panday recently visited Kale Hanuman Ji Temple in Jaipur and expressed gratitude. Currently in Rajasthan for a film shoot, she shared images from her visit on social media.

Kartik Aaryan meets Bhajanlal Sharma during Tu Mera Main Tera shoot in RajasthanBollywood actor Kartik Aaryan met Rajasthan's Chief Minister Bhajanlal Sharma during his film shoot. Jackie Shroff joins the cast of 'Tu Meri Main Tera Main Tera Tu Meri'.

Tanushree Dutta breaks down in video, claims harassment at home since MeToo rowIn a video, actor Tanushree Dutta claimed she has been facing harassment at her home since 2018, following the #MeToo movement. She broke down and said that she would be lodging a police complaint.

Amar Upadhyay on being offered Mihir in Kyunki...: Thought someone had pulled a prankActor Amar Upadhyay is all set to reprise his role of Mihir Virani in Ekta Kapoor 'Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi'. In a new promo, he shared his reaction to being offered the iconic character.

Black Sabbath lead singer Ozzy Osbourne dies at 76, weeks after farewell showThe British rocker rose to fame as the lead singer of Black Sabbath, where his voice became a defining force of heavy metal. He introduced the world to groundbreaking tracks like "Iron Man," "Paranoid," and "War Pigs."

Vidya Balan backs flexible working hours for new mothers amid Deepika-Vanga rowActor Vidya Balan recently spoke about the need for flexible working hours to support new mothers in the film industry. She urged the adoption of empathetic work cultures to retain women workforce in cinema.

Karuppu: Suriya's stylish first look unveiled ahead of teaser launch on birthdayActor Suriya's first look from director RJ Balaji's 'Karuppu' was unveiled ahead of the film's teaser launch. The teaser releases on July 23, which also marks the actor's 50th birthday.

Malvika Raaj flaunts baby bump in pics from Mary Poppins-themed baby showerMalvika Raaj, who played young Poo in 'Kabhi Khushi Kabhie Gham', recently shared dreamy pictures from her Mary Poppins-themed baby shower with husband Pranav Bagga. The couple, who got married in 2023, are now expecting their first child.

Meet Mahesh from Saiyaara, the low-key villain in Krish and Vaani's love storyActor Shaan R Grover got his big break with 'Saiyaara', where he played a strong role as the ex-boyfriend with a negative side. After years of struggle, training, and auditions, this hit film became a turning point in his career.

Rakesh Roshan shares update after angioplasty, urges brain and heart checks post 45Director Rakesh Roshan recently underwent angioplasty after discovering a serious carotid artery blockage. He now urged people above 45 to prioritise preventive heart and brain health checks.

Anne Hathaway shares the most teasing tease of The Devil Wears Prada 2Anne Hathaway teased her return as Andy Sachs in 'The Devil Wears Prada 2' with a stylish video and photo, exciting fans about the upcoming sequel. Disney has confirmed the film is in development, with original stars and new cast members set to join.

Avatar: Fire and Ash trailer to premiere in theatres before Fantastic FourThe trailer for 'Avatar: Fire and Ash' will be shown exclusively with 'The Fantastic Four: First Steps'. It will offer a glimpse into the new Na'vi tribes and their conflicts.
Lady Gaga tumbles mid-performance during Mayhem Ball Tour in Las VegasThe iconic singer fell awkwardly after her cameraman nearly lost his balance. Watch the video.

Salman Khan restores vintage Triumph bike bought by father Salim Khan in 1956Salman Khan shares a heartfelt story about restoring his father's first bike, a Triumph Tiger 100, from a Hyderabad junkyard.

Dulquer Salmaan to distribute Raj B Shetty's Su From So in MalayalamMalayalam actor Dulquer Salman will be distributing the Malayalam dubbed version of Kannada film 'Su From So' under his banner, Wayfarer Films. 'Su From So' has been produced under Kannada actor Raj B Shetty's Lighter Buddha Films.

Aamir Khan breaks silence on rumours of making a film on Meghalaya murder caseAamir Khan clarifies he is not working on a film about a recent murder case in Meghalaya, dismissing circulating rumours. The actor addressed speculation in an interview, stating such reports are unfounded.

Son of Sardaar 2 duja trailer: Ajay Devgn caught between love, mafia and mayhemA new trailer for actor Ajay Devgn's 'Son of Sardaar 2' was released on Wednesday. It offers a deeper look into the comedic chaos surrounding Jassi's life. The film also stars Neeru Bajwa, Mrunal Thakur, Deepak Dobriyal and Ravi Kishan in key roles.

I would love to surrender in love: Fatima Sana Shaikh l ExclusiveActor Fatima Sana Shaikh recently opened up on what love means to her in today's world. In an interaction with India Today, she also highlighted the challenges of dating apps and the craving for genuine connection in modern times.

general news.headline: Steeped in fanaticism, serial borrower from IMF: India blasts Pak at UNParvathaneni Harish also issued a strong message on the need for accountability in terror cases, citing the April 22 terrorist attack in Pahalgam, Jammu and Kashmir, in which 26 civilians were killed.

Dhankhar exit: What happened between 1 pm and 4.30 pm broke the camel's backVice-President Jagdeep Dhankhar surprised one and all by resigning late Monday evening, citing health as the reason. Opposition leaders and developments of the day suggest there's more to the story than what meets the eye. What happened between 1 pm and 4.30 pm that turned a normal day into an extraordinary evening?

PM's UK, Maldives visit to begin today, trade deal, diplomatic reset on agendaPM Modi's UK visit aims to seal a historic free trade pact boosting exports and defence ties, before he heads to the Maldives as guest of honour for the island nation's Independence Day.

Next to go: Trump targets Jimmy Kimmel after Colbert's show cancellationTrump's remarks come days after CBS announced that The Late Show with Stephen Colbert will end in May 2026 after a successful 10-year run.

A month after the incident and much hue and cry, Balochistan police have arrested 13 people, including the tribal chief who ordered the killings.

Police were treating the incident as an apparent hate crime.

Gill sticks his ground on 3rd Test controversy: It didn't come out of nowhereIndia captain Shubman Gill stood his ground regarding the Lord's Test controversy and blasted England for their time-wasting antics ahead of the fourth match of the series. Gill had a heated run-in with England openers Zak Crawley and Ben Duckett.

More important things: Top court on case against Shashi Tharoor over remark on PMReacting on the criminal defamation case filed against Congress leader Shashi Tharoor over his 'scorpion sitting on Shivling' remark targeting Prime Minister Narendra Modi, the Supreme Court said there were "more important things" the court should be spending time on.

Mother granted child's custody for 'better well-being' despite personal lawsIn 2023, a family court in Nilanga granted custody to the father, citing concerns about the child's living conditions with the mother, including overcrowding, possible neglect, and allegations that she was in a relationship with another man.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
